ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] does anyone else have problems..
ygData.msgSnippet: I have a Geforce 2 Ultra and it shot craps on me today. After talking to tech support to determine that the card is indeed dead, and finding out that I won t
ygData.messageBody:
I have a Geforce 2 Ultra and it shot craps on me today. After talking to
tech support to determine that the card is indeed dead, and finding out that
I won't get the warranty replacement until Monday at the earliest via FedEx
(it is Thursday night/Friday morning now), I resurrected my old VooDoo 3
3000 out of its resting place in the bottom desk drawer and installed it in
my PC. After going to www.3dfx.com and downloading the latest drivers and
installing them, I had 3 hours of flawless EQ action in Lake of Ill Omen,
one of the laggiest zones in the game (DING 25!).
.
If you ask me (yeah, I know, you didn't ask me, but oh well), I think the
Voodoo 3 looks better than the Geforce 2 Ultra. Maybe it doesn't _perform_
better -- I know the specs are far inferior -- but the images on the monitor
sure look better, and EQ behaved better.

----- Original Message -----
From: "Su" <suceress@...>
To: <EverQuest@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, May 31, 2001 6:16 PM
Subject: [EverQuest] does anyone else have problems..


> with a voodoo3 3000?
> I have spent hours in tech support trying to get this ressolved but kept
> getting booted out to server select or desktop while waiting my turn and
> losing my place in line..
> My computer screen freezes up at random during eq. I took all of the
advice
> suggested to remedy the situation. I even tested the card in another
> computer and it had the same problem.
> Anyone else have a voodoo3 3000?
> luv,
